name: Developer-Provided Training
description: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to provide [Assignment: organization-defined training] on the correct use and operation of the implemented security and privacy functions, controls, and/or mechanisms.
supplemental_guidance: Developer-provided training applies to external and internal (in-house) developers. Training of personnel is essential to ensuring the effectiveness of the controls implemented within organizational systems.

rev5.name: Developer-Provided Training
rev5.description: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to provide [Assignment: organization-defined training] on the correct use and operation of the implemented security and privacy functions, controls, and/or mechanisms.
rev5.discussion: Developer-provided training applies to external and internal (in-house) developers. Training of personnel is essential to ensuring the effectiveness of the controls implemented within organizational systems.

attack_techniques.name: Default Accounts
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Developer-provided training on correct system configuration ensures that administrators understand proper default-account management—including disabling, renaming, or restricting default credentials—reducing the risk of adversary exploitation.

attack_techniques.name: Local Accounts
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Training on secure system operation ensures that administrators properly manage local accounts, understanding password policies, privilege restrictions, and monitoring requirements that reduce adversary exploitation of local credentials.

attack_techniques.name: DLL Side-Loading
attack_techniques.mapping_rationale: Developer-provided training educates operators on DLL side-loading risks in their products, enabling proper configuration of application installation paths and trust settings that prevent adversary exploitation of known side-loading vulnerabilities.

metadata.review_notes: Generated from NIST SP 800-53 Rev 5 with compliance mappings from framework-coverage data
